title: Sophia Eleonore of Saxony
text:
Sophia Eleonore of Saxony (23 November 1609 – 2 June 1671) was a duchess of <a href="Electorate%20of%20Saxony">Saxony</a> by birth and the <a href="List%20of%20Hessian%20consorts%23Landgravines%20of%20Hesse-Darmstadt%20%281567%E2%80%931806%29">landgravine</a> of <a href="Landgraviate%20of%20Hesse-Darmstadt">Hesse-Darmstadt</a> from 1627 to 1661 through her marriage to <a href="Landgrave">Landgrave</a> <a href="George%20II%2C%20Landgrave%20of%20Hesse-Darmstadt">George II</a>. She was the eldest surviving child of <a href="John%20George%20I%2C%20Elector%20of%20Saxony">John George I, Elector of Saxony</a>, and <a href="Duchess%20Magdalene%20Sibylle%20of%20Prussia">Magdalene Sibylle of Prussia</a>. 
Life.
She was born in <a href="Dresden">Dresden</a>. Her two sisters were <a href="Duchess%20Marie%20Elisabeth%20of%20Saxony">Marie Elisabeth</a> and <a href="Magdalene%20Sibylle%20of%20Saxony">Magdalene Sibylle</a>. Her brothers were <a href="John%20George%20II%2C%20Elector%20of%20Saxony">Johann Georg</a>, <a href="Augustus%2C%20Duke%20of%20Saxe-Weissenfels">August</a>, <a href="Christian%20I%2C%20Duke%20of%20Saxe-Merseburg">Christian</a>, and <a href="Maurice%2C%20Duke%20of%20Saxe-Zeitz">Maurice</a>.
She married Landgrave <a href="George%20II%2C%20Landgrave%20of%20Hesse-Darmstadt">Georg II of Hesse-Darmstadt</a> on 1 April 1627 in <a href="Torgau">Torgau</a>, aged seventeen. In the middle of <a href="Thirty%20Years%27%20War">Thirty Years' War</a> their marriage was lavishly celebrated with the first opera in German language. They had fifteen children; she raised them as strict <a href="Lutheranism">Lutheran</a>s. However, her daughter Elisabeth Amalie, later Electress Palatine, converted to <a href="Roman%20Catholicism">Roman Catholicism</a> in 1653.
Sophie Eleonore showed huge interest in antiquarian books which she collected. Her contribution to the Hesse-Darmstadt court library is still visible today. She survived her husband by ten years and died in <a href="Darmstadt">Darmstadt</a>.
Children.
She had the following children with <a href="George%20II%2C%20Landgrave%20of%20Hesse-Darmstadt">George II, Landgrave of Hesse-Darmstadt</a>:
